articles.content:
Congratulatory message to Frelimo Party 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the Frelimo Party (the Mozambique Liberation Front Party) yesterday on the occasion of its 40th anniversary.
 The message said that the Frelimo Party has won great victory in the sacred struggle to achieve the independence of the country and defend the sovereignty of the nation over the last 40 years and made positive efforts to strengthen the national unity and attain the independent development of the country, enjoying support from the broad strata of people.    
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message wished the party greater success in its work to strengthen the party and consolidate the political stability of the country.

articles.content:
Greetings to Slovak President
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Slovak President Milan Kucan on the occasion of the independence day.
 In the belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the Slovak people progress and prosperity.

articles.content:
Greetings to Croatian President
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Croatian President Stipe Mesic on the National Day. 
 The message wished him success in his responsible work and the Croatian people progress and prosperity.

Greetings to Slovak prime minister and foreign minister
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Janez Drnovsek, prime minister of Slovakia, on the Independence Day. 
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message wholeheartedly wished the Slovak people sustained progress and prosperity.    
 Meanwhile, foreign minister Paek Nam Sun also sent a message of greetings to his counterpart Dimitrij Rupel.
